org.eclipse.keyple.core.plugin

Interface WaitForCardInsertionBlocking

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ObservableReader, ObservableReaderNotifier, Reader

    public interface WaitForCardInsertionBlocking
extends ObservableReaderNotifier
    Interface to be implemented by readers that are autonomous in the management of waiting for the insertion of a card and that provide a method to wait for it indefinitely.

    A typical example of readers conforming to this mode of operation are PC/SC type readers capable of performing RF polling without waiting for a command from the application.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.eclipse.keyple.core.service.event.ObservableReader

        ObservableReader.NotificationMode, ObservableReader.PollingMode, ObservableReader.ReaderObserver

    • Method Detail

      • waitForCardPresent

        boolean waitForCardPresent()
        Waits for a card. Returns true if a card is detected, false it was interrupted or if the reader is no longer able to detect a card.

        This method must be implemented by the plugin's reader class when it implements the WaitForCardInsertionBlocking interface.

        Returns false if no card is detected.

        Returns:
        presence status
        Throws:
        KeypleReaderIOException - if the communication with the reader or the card has failed (disconnection)

      • stopWaitForCard

        void stopWaitForCard()
        Interrupts the waiting of a card
